intro: Isotrema kunmingense, commonly known as the Yunnan isotrema, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit and distinctive, narrow leaves with a smooth surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
